com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.archetypes: Each player shuffles all Pokémon in his or her discard pile into his or her deck.
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.decks.2016: While protecting your team with the mystic power of Magearna-EX, you can use this deck's Metal and Shield Energy to power up Mawile and Cobalion. Sharpen the edge of your attack with the Heart's Shield deck!

Spin up that powerful little dynamo, Pikachu-EX, and switch on full power! The Thunder's Crash deck uses Magnezone and Pikachu-EX to create a massive charge—and big damage. Add Clemont and Misty's Determination to keep rolling strong!

Follow a fiery path with Volcanion-EX! Trainer cards help keep your hand fueled up, while Blaziken's Spreading Flames attack stokes those fires and keeps the streak going, so you can burn twice as hot with the Mountain's Fury deck!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.decks.pcds: Main Pokémon: Articuno, Gyarados, Lapras\nChill your opponent to the bone with this Water-type deck! Articuno can find Energy and then let loose a Freezing Wind attack. Gyarados can hit the opposing Pokémon hard and weaken every other Pokémon in play with a Berserker Splash. Lapras helps out by fetching from your deck the exact Trainer card you need! Add some awesome Trainer and Energy cards like Max Revive and Splash Energy to keep your deck strong for the long battle, and this deck displays the hidden power of the deeps!

Main Pokémon: Moltres, Ninetales, Arcanine\nBurn it up with this Fire-type deck! Arcanine and Rapidash have big attacks that discard Energy—attach a Burning Energy so it comes right back, or use an Energy Retrieval Trainer card. Moltres is a giant Basic Pokémon that can deliver huge damage at the cost of hitting itself. And when Ninetales attacks with Flickering Flames, the hypnotic effect leaves your opponent's Pokémon Asleep. With Trainer cards like Scorched Earth and Professor Sycamore to keep your hand fired up, you can really bring on the heat!

Main Pokémon: Zapdos, Raichu, Kangaskhan\nThis Lightning-type deck is a rolling slugfest! Kangaskhan brings the big hits while Zapdos unleashes its Raging Thunder. Raticate can leave your opponent's Pokémon Poisoned, but they can't return the favor because it's immune to Special Conditions. With an extra-full Bench thanks to the Sky Field Stadium card, Raichu's Circle Circuit attack can hit for tons of damage! Finally, Trainer cards like Potion and Pokémon Fan Club can keep you in the game, and Double Colorless Energy can power up your Pokémon fast!

Rayquaza-EX teams up with Zekrom, Zapdos, and Raichu to make this Battle Arena Deck a contender! You'll also find powerful Trainer cards such as Archie's Ace in the Hole, N, and the never-before-seen Karen!

Keldeo-EX teams up with Blastoise, Milotic, and Articuno to give this Battle Arena Deck a real kick! You'll also find powerful Trainer cards such as Float Stone, Battle Compressor, and the never-before-seen Karen!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.eventtrigg: Won with Born of Fire Reward
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.products.b: Two Mighty Pokémon Battle for Victory! Rayquaza and Keldeo go head to head in the new Pokémon TCG Battle Arena Decks! These two 60-card decks are ready to play right away, with powerful cards and winning strategies worthy of an ace Trainer! Each deck is led by an exceptional Pokémon-EX and includes 10 foil cards. Let the battle begin! In each 60-card deck, you'll find: • 2 foil cards featuring Rayquaza-EX or Keldeo-EX • 8 foil basic Energy cards • Tournament-level Trainer cards, including VS Seeker, N, and the never-before-seen Karen! In addition, each box contains: • 2 metallic coins • 2 deck boxes
Battle Arena Decks: Rayquaza vs. Keldeo
deckbuilder.alerts.invalidreasons.explan: Your deck is currently invalid. Before it's valid for play, you must address the following:
error.accounts.alreadyupgraded: You cannot upgrade with a previously existing account. To upgrade, please create a new account.
playmat.prompt.select2basicgrasspokemonf: Choose up to 2 Basic {G} Pokémon to put onto your Bench.
playmat.prompt.xy11_34.megaboost.special: Choose a Special Energy to attach to a Mega Evolution Pokémon.

tutorial.collection.holly: Let's see what you get! [34ff0f]Click on your pack to select it. Then, click the Open button.[-]
tutorial.collection.holly.ios: Let's see what you get! [34ff0f]Tap your pack to select it. Then, tap the Open button.[-]
tutorial.complete.holly: Congratulations! Here are your rewards! Let's head over to the Collection to open your booster pack.
tutorial.complete.holly.ios: Congratulations! Here are your rewards! Let's head over to the Collection to open your booster pack.
tutorial.constructeddecks.holly: In this mode, you play with constructed decks you've built in the Deck Manager. If you're not ready for that, you can always play with theme decks by switching the mode.
tutorial.constructeddecks.holly.ios: In this mode, you play with constructed decks you've built in the Deck Manager. If you're not ready for that, you can always play with theme decks by switching the mode.
tutorial.defeatgoldleague.holly: Congratulations on winning the Gold League! If you want, you can try facing off against Trainers from around the world in Versus Mode!
tutorial.defeatgoldleague.holly.ios: Congratulations on winning the Gold League! If you want, you can try facing off against Trainers from around the world in Versus Mode!
tutorial.failfeedback.energy: Eevee already has enough Energy to use its biggest attack, so you should attach the <img=symbols/lightning/> Energy to Pikachu.
tutorial.failfeedback.energy.ios: Eevee already has enough Energy to use its biggest attack, so you should attach the <img=symbols/lightning/> Energy to Pikachu.
tutorial.game1.message1: Hello! I'm Professor Holly, and I'm going to teach you how to play the Pokémon Trading Card Game!
tutorial.game1.message1.ios: Hello! I'm Professor Holly, and I'm going to teach you how to play the Pokémon Trading Card Game!
tutorial.game1.message10: Smash Kick did 10 damage! Rattata has 40 HP, so 30 more damage is enough for a Knock Out. [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message10.ios: Smash Kick did 10 damage! Rattata has 40 HP, so 30 more damage is enough for a Knock Out. [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message11: Eevee has a stronger attack that requires more Energy. [34ff0f]Attach another <img=symbols/lightning> Energy.[-]
tutorial.game1.message11.ios: Eevee has a stronger attack that requires more Energy. [34ff0f]Attach another <img=symbols/lightning> Energy.[-]
tutorial.game1.message12: Tail Whap costs two Energy of any type. Eevee has two <img=symbols/lightning> Energy attached, so you can use it now!
tutorial.game1.message12.ios: Tail Whap costs two Energy of any type. Eevee has two <img=symbols/lightning> Energy attached, so you can use it now!
tutorial.game1.message13: Zach's Rattata is almost Knocked Out. He'll put another Pokémon onto his Bench as backup. [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message13.ios: Zach's Rattata is almost Knocked Out. He'll put another Pokémon onto his Bench as backup. [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message14: You just drew a Trainer card. [34ff0f]Right-click on Potion to take a closer look.[-]
tutorial.game1.message14.ios: You just drew a Trainer card. [34ff0f]Double-tap on Potion to take a closer look.[-]
tutorial.game1.message15: Trainer cards have special effects that can help you out. [34ff0f]Click on the playmat to unzoom Potion.[-]
tutorial.game1.message15.ios: Trainer cards have special effects that can help you out. [34ff0f]Tap on the playmat to unzoom Potion.[-]
tutorial.game1.message16: Let's use the Potion to heal Eevee! [34ff0f]Drag Potion onto Eevee.[-]
tutorial.game1.message16.ios: Let's use the Potion to heal Eevee! [34ff0f]Drag Potion onto Eevee.[-]
tutorial.game1.message17: Rattata only has 10 HP left! [34ff0f]Use Tail Whap to Knock Out Zach's Rattata![-]
tutorial.game1.message17.ios: Rattata only has 10 HP left! [34ff0f]Use Tail Whap to Knock Out Zach's Rattata![-]
tutorial.game1.message18: When you Knock Out a Pokémon, you get to take a Prize card! Take all of your Prize cards to win the game! [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message18.ios: When you Knock Out a Pokémon, you get to take a Prize card! Take all of your Prize cards to win the game! [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message19: Now Zach will pick a Pokémon from his Bench to become his new Active Pokémon. [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message19.ios: Now Zach will pick a Pokémon from his Bench to become his new Active Pokémon. [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message2: Let's take a look at a Pokémon card. [34ff0f]Right-click on Eevee to zoom in.[-] By the way, Zach will be helping us out today.
tutorial.game1.message2.ios: Let's take a look at a Pokémon card. [34ff0f]Double-tap on Eevee to zoom in.[-] By the way, Zach will be helping us out today.
tutorial.game1.message20: Meowth's Fury Swipes attack lets Zach flip three coins. For each heads, the attack does 10 damage! [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message20.ios: Meowth's Fury Swipes attack lets Zach flip three coins. For each heads, the attack does 10 damage! [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message21: You drew Pikachu! You should put it onto your Bench just in case Eevee gets Knocked Out.
tutorial.game1.message21.ios: You drew Pikachu! You should put it onto your Bench just in case Eevee gets Knocked Out.
tutorial.game1.message22: Oh no! Eevee got Knocked Out, and Zach took a Prize card! Good thing you've got a Pokémon on your Bench! [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message22.ios: Oh no! Eevee got Knocked Out, and Zach took a Prize card! Good thing you've got a Pokémon on your Bench! [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message23: One more attack should Knock Out Zach's Meowth, and since he doesn’t have any Pokémon on his Bench, you'll win the game!
tutorial.game1.message23.ios: One more attack should Knock Out Zach's Meowth, and since he doesn’t have any Pokémon on his Bench, you'll win the game!
tutorial.game1.message2b: This is my favorite game. I hope you have fun!
tutorial.game1.message2b.ios: This is my favorite game. I hope you have fun!
tutorial.game1.message3: As you can see, Eevee is a Basic Pokémon that has 50 HP and two attacks. [34ff0f]Click on the playmat to unzoom Eevee.[-]
tutorial.game1.message3.ios: As you can see, Eevee is a Basic Pokémon that has 50 HP and two attacks. [34ff0f]Tap on the playmat to unzoom Eevee.[-]
tutorial.game1.message4: You start by placing a Basic Pokémon in the active position. [34ff0f]Click and drag Eevee to the Active Pokémon position.[-]
tutorial.game1.message4.ios: You start by placing a Basic Pokémon in the active position. [34ff0f]Drag Eevee to the Active Pokémon position.[-]
tutorial.game1.message5: Each player starts their turn by drawing a card. [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message5.ios: Each player starts their turn by drawing a card. [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message6: Energy allows Pokémon to attack; you can attach one per turn. Zach will attach a <img=symbols/metal> Energy to his Rattata. [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message6.ios: Energy allows Pokémon to attack; you can attach one per turn. Zach will attach a <img=symbols/metal> Energy to his Rattata. [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game1.message7: Now it's your turn! You drew a <img=symbols/lightning> Energy! Let's attach it to Eevee! [34ff0f]Drag the <img=symbols/lightning> Energy onto Eevee.[-]
tutorial.game1.message7.ios: Now it's your turn! You drew a <img=symbols/lightning> Energy! Let's attach it to Eevee! [34ff0f]Drag the <img=symbols/lightning> Energy onto Eevee.[-]
tutorial.game1.message8: The player who goes first can’t attack, however, you can since you went second! [34ff0f]Select Eevee to attack.[-]
tutorial.game1.message8.ios: The player who goes first can’t attack, however, you can since you went second! [34ff0f]Select Eevee to attack.[-]
tutorial.game1.message9: To use Smash Kick, Eevee needs one Energy of any type <img=symbols/colorless>. You played a <img=symbols/lightning> Energy this turn! [34ff0f]Attack with Smash Kick![-]
tutorial.game1.message9.ios: To use Smash Kick, Eevee needs one Energy of any type <img=symbols/colorless>. You played a <img=symbols/lightning> Energy this turn! [34ff0f]Attack with Smash Kick![-]
tutorial.game2.interstitial: Good job! My daughter, Ella, is going to help me teach you some more advanced rules.
tutorial.game2.interstitial.ios: Good job! My daughter, Ella, is going to help me teach you some more advanced rules.
tutorial.game2.message0: My mom is a good teacher, right?
tutorial.game2.message0.ios: My mom is a good teacher, right?
tutorial.game2.message1: Remember, the player who goes first can't attack on their first turn.[34ff0f] Make sure to select End Turn when you can’t attack.[-]
tutorial.game2.message1.ios: Remember, the player who goes first can't attack on their first turn.[34ff0f] Make sure to select End Turn when you can’t attack.[-]
tutorial.game2.message2: Make sure you have a Pokémon on your Bench in case your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out!
tutorial.game2.message2.ios: Make sure you have a Pokémon on your Bench in case your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out!
tutorial.game2.message3: Ella just drew the Stage 1 Evolution for Jigglypuff. Now she can evolve it into Wigglytuff! [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game2.message3.ios: Ella just drew the Stage 1 Evolution for Jigglypuff. Now she can evolve it into Wigglytuff! [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game2.message4: You just drew Raichu. Now your Pikachu can evolve, too! [34ff0f]Drag Raichu onto Pikachu.[-]
tutorial.game2.message4.ios: You just drew Raichu. Now your Pikachu can evolve, too! [34ff0f]Drag Raichu onto Pikachu.[-]
tutorial.game2.message5: Raichu has enough Energy to attack. [34ff0f]Attack with Thunder Shock![-]
tutorial.game2.message5.ios: Raichu has enough Energy to attack. [34ff0f]Attack with Thunder Shock![-]
tutorial.game2.message6: Ella's Wigglytuff is close to being Knocked Out. She can discard two Energy to retreat her Wigglytuff. [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game2.message6.ios: Ella's Wigglytuff is close to being Knocked Out. She can discard two Energy to retreat her Wigglytuff. [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game2.message6a: Watch out! Raichu took more damage from Sandshrew's attack because it's weak to Fighting-type Pokémon! [34ff0f]Click anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game2.message6a.ios: Watch out! Raichu took more damage from Sandshrew's attack because it's weak to Fighting-type Pokémon! [34ff0f]Tap anywhere to continue.[-]
tutorial.game2.message7: Now that you know how to retreat and evolve your Pokémon, you’re ready to play on your own. Let’s see if you can win this game!
tutorial.game2.message7.ios: Now that you know how to retreat and evolve your Pokémon, you’re ready to play on your own. Let’s see if you can win this game!
tutorial.game3.interstitial.calvin: My name is Calvin. Looks like we're up next…
tutorial.game3.interstitial.calvin.ios: My name is Calvin. Looks like we're up next…
tutorial.game3.interstitial.holly: Great job! Let's see how you do against other Trainers. Defeat them to earn a booster pack and a powerful Pokémon-GX! Good luck!
tutorial.game3.interstitial.holly.ios: Great job! Let's see how you do against other Trainers. Defeat them to earn a booster pack and a powerful Pokémon-GX! Good luck!
tutorial.game4.interstitial.ali: Hey. I'm Ali. Let's see what you've got!
tutorial.game4.interstitial.ali.ios: Hey. I'm Ali. Let's see what you've got!
tutorial.game5.interstitial.otis: I'm Otis. You've made it to the final match. Good luck.
tutorial.game5.interstitial.otis.ios: I'm Otis. You've made it to the final match. Good luck.
tutorial.gameloss.holly: Tough loss. You almost had it! [34ff0f]Hit the Play! button to try again.[-]
tutorial.gameloss.holly.ios: Tough loss. You almost had it! [34ff0f]Hit the Play! button to try again.[-]
tutorial.packopening.holly: Looks like you opened some good cards.
tutorial.packopening.holly.ios: Looks like you opened some good cards.
tutorial.returninguser.holly: Welcome back! Your next opponent is ready for you. [34ff0f]Hit the Play! button to start.[-]
tutorial.returninguser.holly.ios: Welcome back! Your next opponent is ready for you. [34ff0f]Hit the Play! button to start.[-]
tutorial.trainerchallenge.holly: This is the Trainer Challenge. You can unlock the three basic decks by defeating Trainers. Win the entire Gold League to earn a booster pack!
tutorial.trainerchallenge.holly.ios: This is the Trainer Challenge. You can unlock the three basic decks by defeating Trainers. Win the entire Gold League to earn a booster pack!
tutorial.trainerchallengeloss.holly: That's a tough loss, but don't worry! In the Trainer Challenge, you can switch decks to take advantage of a Trainer's weakness. You might want to pick a different deck and try again.
tutorial.trainerchallengeloss.holly.ios: That's a tough loss, but don't worry! In the Trainer Challenge, you can switch decks to take advantage of a Trainer's weakness. You might want to pick a different deck and try again.
unsupporteddevice.bump.body: This device is currently not supported, and you may experience stability issues while you play. We apologize for the inconvenience.
unsupporteddevice.gate.body: This device is currently not supported, and the game cannot continue. We apologize for the inconvenience.
